question: Which leadership principle emphasizes starting with the customer and working backwards?
Which principle encourages leaders to act on behalf of the entire company?
Which leadership principle focuses on seeking out innovation?
Which principle believes that leaders have strong judgment and good instincts?
Which principle emphasizes continuous learning?
Which leadership principle is about raising the performance bar with every hire?
Which principle drives leaders to deliver high-quality products and services?
Which leadership principle encourages leaders to create and communicate a bold direction?
Which principle believes that many decisions and actions are reversible and do not need extensive study?
Which leadership principle emphasizes accomplishing more with less?
Which principle encourages leaders to listen attentively and speak candidly?
Which leadership principle is about staying connected to the details?
Which principle encourages leaders to challenge decisions even when it's uncomfortable?
Which leadership principle focuses on delivering results with the right quality?
Which principle believes that constraints breed resourcefulness and invention?
Which leadership principle is about seeking ways to improve oneself?
Which principle believes that leaders should never say 'that's not my job'?
Which leadership principle is about seeking out new ideas even from external sources?
Which principle believes that leaders should always compare themselves to the highest standards?
Which leadership principle is about taking calculated risks?
